7#define DMLC_OPTIONAL_H_

19namespace dmlc {
20
21/*! \brief dummy type for assign null to optional */
22struct nullopt_t {
23#if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1900
24 /*! \brief dummy constructor */
25 explicit nullopt_t(int a) {}
26#else
27 /*! \brief dummy constructor */
28 constexpr explicit nullopt_t(int a) {}
29#endif
30};
31
32/*! Assign null to optional: optional<T> x = nullopt; */
33constexpr const nullopt_t nullopt = nullopt_t(0);
34/*! \brief C++14 aliases */
35template <typename T> using decay_t = typename std::decay<T>::type;
36template <bool B, typename T = void>
37using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
38
39/*! \brief disambiguation tags that can be passed to the constructors of
40 * dmlc::optional. A tag type to tell constructor to construct its value in-place
41 */
42struct in_place_t {
43 explicit in_place_t() = default; // NOLINT(*)
44};
45/*! \brief A tag to tell constructor to construct its value in-place */
46static constexpr in_place_t in_place{};
47
48/*! \brief Is not constructible or convertible from any expression of type
49(possibly const) dmlc::optional<U>, i.e., the following 8 type traits are all
50false: Link: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/optional/optional */
51template <typename T> class optional;
52template <typename T, typename U, typename Other>
53using enable_constructor_from_other =
54 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<T, Other>::value &&
55 !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &>::value &&
56 !std::is_constructible<T, optional<U> &&>::value &&
57 !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &, T>::value &&
58 !std::is_convertible<optional<U> &&, T>::value &&
59 !std::is_constructible<T, const optional<U> &>::value &&
60 !std::is_constructible<T, const optional<U> &&>::value &&
61 !std::is_convertible<const optional<U> &, T>::value &&
62 !std::is_convertible<const optional<U> &&, T>::value>;
63template <typename T, typename U>
64using enable_constructor_from_value =
65 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<T, U &&>::value &&
66 !std::is_same<decay_t<U>, in_place_t>::value &&
67 !std::is_same<optional<T>, decay_t<U>>::value>;
68/*!
69 * \brief c++17 compatible optional class.
70 *
71 * At any time an optional<T> instance either
72 * hold no value (string representation "None")
73 * or hold a value of type T.
74 */
75template <typename T>
76class optional {
77 public:
78 using value_type = T;
79 /*! \brief constructs an object that does not contain a value. */
80 optional() : is_none(true) {}
81 /*! \brief constructs an object that does contain a nullopt value. */
82 optional(dmlc::nullopt_t) noexcept : is_none(true) {} // NOLINT(*)
83 /*! \brief construct an optional object with another optional object */
84 optional(const optional<T>& other) {
85#pragma GCC diagnostic push
86#if __GNUC__ >= 6
87#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmaybe-uninitialized"
88#endif
89 is_none = other.is_none;
90 if (!is_none) {
91 new (&val) T(other.value());
92 }
93#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
94 }
95 /*! \brief move constructor: If other contains a value, then stored value is
96 * direct-intialized with it. */
97 optional(optional &&other) noexcept(
98 std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<T>::value
99 &&std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<T>::value) {
100 if (!other.has_value()) {
101 reset();
102 } else if (has_value()) {
103 **this = std::move(*other);
104 } else {
105 new (&val) T(std::move(*other));
106 is_none = false;
107 }
108 }
109 /*! \brief constructs an optional object that contains a value, initialized as
110 * if direct-initializing */
111 template <typename... Args>
112 explicit optional(
113 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<T, Args...>::value, in_place_t>,
114 Args &&...args) {
115 new (&val) T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
116 is_none = false;
117 }
118 /*! \brief Constructs an optional object that contains a value, initialized as
119 * if direct-initializing */
120 template <typename U, typename... Args>
121 explicit optional(
122 enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::initializer_list<U> &,
123 Args &&...>::value,
124 in_place_t>,
125 std::initializer_list<U> ilist, Args &&...args) {
126 construct(ilist, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
127 }
128 /*! \brief constructs the stored value with value with `other` parameter.*/
129 template <typename U = value_type,
130 enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value> * = nullptr,
131 enable_constructor_from_value<T, U> * = nullptr>
132 optional(U &&other) noexcept { // NOLINT(*)
133 new (&val) T(std::forward<U>(other));
134 is_none = false;
135 }
136 /*! \brief explicit constructor: constructs the stored value with `other`
137 * parameter. */
138 template <typename U = value_type,
139 enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value> * = nullptr,
140 enable_constructor_from_value<T, U> * = nullptr>
141 explicit optional(U &&other) noexcept {
142 new (&val) T(std::forward<U>(other));
143 is_none = false;
144 }
145 /*! \brief converting copy constructor */
146 template <typename U,
147 enable_constructor_from_other<T, U, const U &> * = nullptr,
148 enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<const U &, T>::value> * = nullptr>
149 optional(const optional<U> &other) {
150 if (other.has_value()) {
151 construct(*other);
152 }
153 }
154 /*! \brief explicit converting copy constructor */
155 template <typename U,
156 enable_constructor_from_other<T, U, const U &> * = nullptr,
157 enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<const U &, T>::value> * = nullptr>
158 explicit optional(const optional<U> &other) {
159 if (other.has_value()) {
160 construct(*other);
161 }
162 }
163 /*! \brief converting move constructor */
164 template <typename U, enable_constructor_from_other<T, U, U &&> * = nullptr,
165 enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value> * = nullptr>
166 optional(optional<U> &&other) {
167 if (other.has_value()) {
168 construct(std::move(*other));
169 }
170 }
171 /*! \brief explicit converting move constructor */
172 template <typename U, enable_constructor_from_other<T, U, U &&> * = nullptr,
173 enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<U &&, T>::value> * = nullptr>
174 explicit optional(optional<U> &&other) {
175 if (other.has_value()) {
176 construct(std::move(*other));
177 }
178 }
179 /*! \brief reset */
180 void reset() noexcept {
181 if (!has_value())
182 return;
183 (**this).T::~T();
184 is_none = true;
185 }
186 /*! \brief deconstructor */
187 ~optional() {
188 if (!is_none) {
189 reinterpret_cast<T*>(&val)->~T();
190 }
191 }
192 /*! \brief swap two optional */
193 void swap(optional<T>& other) {
194 std::swap(val, other.val);
195 std::swap(is_none, other.is_none);
196 }
197 /*! \brief set this object to hold value
198 * \param value the value to hold
199 * \return return self to support chain assignment
200 */
201 optional<T>& operator=(const T& value) {
202 (optional<T>(value)).swap(*this);
203 return *this;
204 }
205 /*! \brief set this object to hold the same value with other
206 * \param other the other object
207 * \return return self to support chain assignment
208 */
209 optional<T>& operator=(const optional<T> &other) {
210#pragma GCC diagnostic push
211#if __GNUC__ >= 6
212#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmaybe-uninitialized"
213#endif
214 (optional<T>(other)).swap(*this);
215 return *this;
216#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
217 }
218 /*! \brief clear the value this object is holding.
219 * optional<T> x = nullopt;
220 */
221 optional<T>& operator=(nullopt_t) {
222 (optional<T>()).swap(*this);
223 return *this;
224 }
225 /*! \brief non-const dereference operator */
226 T& operator*() { // NOLINT(*)
227 return *reinterpret_cast<T*>(&val);
228 }
229 /*! \brief const dereference operator */
230 const T& operator*() const {
231 return *reinterpret_cast<const T*>(&val);
232 }
233 /*! \brief equal comparison */
234 bool operator==(const optional<T>& other) const {
235 return this->is_none == other.is_none &&
236 (this->is_none == true || this->value() == other.value());
237 }
238 /*! \brief return the holded value.
239 * throws std::logic_error if holding no value
240 */
241 T &value() & {
242 if (is_none) {
243 throw std::logic_error("bad optional access");
244 }
245 return *reinterpret_cast<T *>(&val);
246 }
247 const T &value() const & {
248 if (is_none) {
249 throw std::logic_error("bad optional access");
250 }
251 return *reinterpret_cast<const T *>(&val);
252 }
253 T &&value() && {
254 if (is_none) {
255 throw std::logic_error("bad optional access");
256 }
257 return std::move(value());
258 }
259 const T &&value() const && {
260 if (is_none) {
261 throw std::logic_error("bad optional access");
262 }
263 return std::move(value());
264 }
265 /*! \brief whether this object is holding a value */
266 explicit operator bool() const { return !is_none; }
267 /*! \brief whether this object is holding a value (alternate form). */
268 bool has_value() const { return operator bool(); }
269
270 private:
271 // whether this is none
272 bool is_none = true;
273 // on stack storage of value
274 typename std::aligned_storage<sizeof(T), alignof(T)>::type val;
275
276 template <typename... Args> void construct(Args &&...args) noexcept {
277 new (std::addressof(val)) T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
278 is_none = false;
279 }
280};
281
282/*! \brief serialize an optional object to string.
283 *
284 * \code
285 * dmlc::optional<int> x;
286 * std::cout << x; // None
287 * x = 0;
288 * std::cout << x; // 0
289 * \endcode
290 *
291 * \param os output stream
292 * \param t source optional<T> object
293 * \return output stream
294 */
295template<typename T>
296std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &os, const optional<T> &t) {
297 if (t) {
298 os << *t;
299 } else {
300 os << "None";
301 }
302 return os;
303}
304
305/*! \brief parse a string object into optional<T>
306 *
307 * \code
308 * dmlc::optional<int> x;
309 * std::string s1 = "1";
310 * std::istringstream is1(s1);
311 * s1 >> x; // x == optional<int>(1)
312 *
313 * std::string s2 = "None";
314 * std::istringstream is2(s2);
315 * s2 >> x; // x == optional<int>()
316 * \endcode
317 *
318 * \param is input stream
319 * \param t target optional<T> object
320 * \return input stream
321 */
322template<typename T>
323std::istream &operator>>(std::istream &is, optional<T> &t) {
324 char buf[4];
325 std::streampos origin = is.tellg();
326 is.read(buf, 4);
327 if (is.fail() || buf[0] != 'N' || buf[1] != 'o' ||
328 buf[2] != 'n' || buf[3] != 'e') {
329 is.clear();
330 is.seekg(origin);
331 T x;
332 is >> x;
333 t = x;
334 if (std::is_integral<T>::value && !is.eof() && is.peek() == 'L') is.get();
335 } else {
336 t = nullopt;
337 }
338 return is;
339}
340/*! \brief specialization of '>>' istream parsing for optional<bool>
341 *
342 * Permits use of generic parameter FieldEntry<DType> class to create
343 * FieldEntry<optional<bool>> without explicit specialization.
344 *
345 * \code
346 * dmlc::optional<bool> x;
347 * std::string s1 = "true";
348 * std::istringstream is1(s1);
349 * s1 >> x; // x == optional<bool>(true)
350 *
351 * std::string s2 = "None";
352 * std::istringstream is2(s2);
353 * s2 >> x; // x == optional<bool>()
354 * \endcode
355 *
356 * \param is input stream
357 * \param t target optional<bool> object
358 * \return input stream
359 */
360inline std::istream &operator>>(std::istream &is, optional<bool> &t) {
361 // Discard initial whitespace
362 while (isspace(is.peek()))
363 is.get();
364 // Extract chars that might be valid into a separate string, stopping
365 // on whitespace or other non-alphanumerics such as ",)]".
366 std::string s;
367 while (isalnum(is.peek()))
368 s.push_back(is.get());
369
370 if (!is.fail()) {
371 std::transform(s.begin(), s.end(), s.begin(), ::tolower);
372 if (s == "1" || s == "true")
373 t = true;
374 else if (s == "0" || s == "false")
375 t = false;
376 else if (s == "none")
377 t = nullopt;
378 else
379 is.setstate(std::ios::failbit);
380 }
381
382 return is;
383}
384
385/*! \brief description for optional int */
386DMLC_DECLARE_TYPE_NAME(optional<int>, "int or None");
387/*! \brief description for optional bool */
388DMLC_DECLARE_TYPE_NAME(optional<bool>, "boolean or None");
389/*! \brief description for optional float */
390DMLC_DECLARE_TYPE_NAME(optional<float>, "float or None");
391/*! \brief description for optional double */
392DMLC_DECLARE_TYPE_NAME(optional<double>, "double or None");
393
394} // namespace dmlc
395
396namespace std {
397/*! \brief std hash function for optional */
398template<typename T>
399struct hash<dmlc::optional<T> > {
400 /*!
401 * \brief returns hash of the optional value.
402 * \param val value.
403 * \return hash code.
404 */
405 size_t operator()(const dmlc::optional<T>& val) const {
406 std::hash<bool> hash_bool;
407 size_t res = hash_bool(val.has_value());
408 if (val.has_value()) {
409 res = dmlc::HashCombine(res, val.value());
410 }
411 return res;
412 }
413};
414} // namespace std
415
416#endif // DMLC_OPTIONAL_H_
